body_content.explanation: used as the subject of a verb to refer to a group including the speaker and at least one other person:
examples: Can we all go to the swimming pool this afternoon?
If you don't hurry up we'll be late.

body_content.explanation: used by a speaker or a writer to refer to themselves and the people listening or reading:
examples: In today's lecture, we will be exploring the world economic situation.

body_content.explanation: used as the subject of a verb to refer to all people, especially when considered as a group:
examples: This planet on which we all live should be cherished and not exploited.

body_content.explanation: used as the subject of a verb to mean "you", especially when talking to a child or someone who is ill:
examples: We don't want to be late for school, do we?
"How are we this morning, Mrs Flanagan?" said the doctor.

body_content.explanation: used by a queen or king when speaking officially to mean "I"
